channel.title: Web3 Security Paper Digest
channel.description: Curated papers on Web3, blockchain, and smart contract security from ArXiv and ACL

item.title: TxRay: Agentic Postmortem of Live Blockchain Attacks
item.description:
Summary

  • Introduces TxRay, an LLM-driven agentic system that reconstructs Anyone-Can-Take (ACT) DeFi exploits from limited seed transactions, produces evidence-backed root causes, and generates runnable, self-contained PoCs with executable semantic oracles.
  • Implements PoCEvaluator, an independent agentic execution-and-review tool to validate PoC correctness and quality.
  • Evaluated on 114 DeFi incidents: TxRay produces expert-aligned root causes and executable PoCs for 105 incidents (92.11% end-to-end reproduction); 98.1% of PoCs avoid hard-coding attacker addresses and median delivery times in live deployment are ~40â€“59 minutes.

Paper Type

  • Research

Additional Information

  • Authors: ['Ziyue Wang', 'Jiangshan Yu', 'Kaihua Qin', 'Dawn Song', 'Arthur Gervais', 'Liyi Zhou']
  • Tags: ['smart-contract-exploit-analysis', 'DeFi', 'automated-PoC-generation', 'postmortem-forensics', 'LLM-agent']

item.title: SPEAR: An Engineering Case Study of Multi-Agent Coordination for Smart Contract Auditing
item.description:
Summary

  • Presents SPEAR, a multi-agent framework for automating smart contract auditing using specialized agents (Planning, Execution, Repair) and MAS coordination patterns.
  • Implements risk-aware contract prioritization, task allocation via the Contract Net protocol, AGM-compliant belief revision, and an autonomous programmatic repair policy for brittle artifacts.
  • Evaluates the multi-agent design against centralized and pipeline baselines under controlled failure scenarios, measuring coordination, recovery behavior, and resource utilization.

Paper Type

  • Research

Additional Information

  • Authors: ['Arnab Mallick', 'Indraveni Chebolu', 'Harmesh Rana']
  • Tags: ['smart contract auditing', 'multi-agent systems', 'automated vulnerability detection', 'program repair']
